groups.name: accent_colors
groups.title: Accent Colors
groups.description: These colors are used across many different widgets, such as buttons, labels, and entries, to indicate that a widget is important, interactive, or currently active.

variables.name: accent_color
variables.title: Standalone Color
variables.explanation: The standalone colors are similar to the background ones, but provide better contrast when used as foreground color on top of a neutral background - for example, colorful text in a window.

groups.name: destructive_colors
groups.title: Destructive Colors
groups.description: These colors are used for buttons to indicate a dangerous action, such as deleting a file.

variables.name: destructive_color
variables.title: Standalone Color
variables.explanation: The standalone colors are similar to the background ones, but provide better contrast when used as foreground color on top of a neutral background - for example, colorful text in a window.

groups.name: success_colors
groups.title: Success Colors
groups.description: These colors are used across many different widgets, such as buttons, labels, entries, and level bars, to indicate a success or a high level.

variables.name: success_color
variables.title: Standalone Color
variables.explanation: The standalone colors are similar to the background ones, but provide better contrast when used as foreground color on top of a neutral background - for example, colorful text in a window.

groups.name: warning_colors
groups.title: Warning Colors
groups.description: These colors are used across many different widgets, such as buttons, labels, entries, and level bars, to indicate a warning or a low level.

variables.name: warning_color
variables.title: Standalone Color
variables.explanation: The standalone colors are similar to the background ones, but provide better contrast when used as foreground color on top of a neutral background - for example, colorful text in a window.

groups.name: error_colors
groups.title: Error Colors
groups.description: These colors are used across many different widgets, such as buttons, labels, and entries, to indicate a failure.

variables.name: error_color
variables.title: Standalone Color
variables.explanation: The standalone colors are similar to the background ones, but provide better contrast when used as foreground color on top of a neutral background - for example, colorful text in a window.

groups.name: window_colors
groups.title: Window Colors
groups.description: These colors are used primarily for windows.

groups.name: view_colors
groups.title: View Colors
groups.description: These colors are used in a variety of widgets, such as text views and entries.

groups.name: headerbar_colors
groups.title: Header Bar Colors
groups.description: These colors are used for header bars, as well as widgets that are meant to be visually attached to it, such as search bars or tab bars.

variables.name: headerbar_border_color
variables.title: Border Color
variables.explanation: The border color has the same default value as a foreground color, but doesn't change along with it. This can be useful if a light window has a dark header bar with light text; in this case it may be desirable to keep the border dark. This variable is only used for vertical borders - for example, separators between the two header bars in a split header bar layout.

variables.name: headerbar_backdrop_color
variables.title: Backdrop Color
variables.explanation: The backdrop color is used instead of the background color when the window is not focused. By default it's an alias of the window's background color and changes together with it. When changing this variable, make sure to set it to a value matching your header bar background color.

variables.name: headerbar_shade_color
variables.title: Shade Color
variables.explanation: The shade color is used to provide a dark border for header bars and similar widgets that separates them from the main window.

groups.name: card_colors
groups.title: Card Colors
groups.description: These colors are used for cards and boxed lists.

variables.name: card_shade_color
variables.title: Shade Color
variables.explanation: The shade color is used for shadows that are used by cards to separate themselves from the window background, as well as for row dividers in the cards.

groups.name: dialog_colors
groups.title: Dialog Colors
groups.description: These colors are used for message dialogs.

groups.name: popover_colors
groups.title: Popover Colors
groups.description: These colors are used for popovers.

groups.name: misc_colors
groups.title: Miscalleneous Colors
groups.description: Colors that don't fit in any particular group.

variables.name: shade_color
variables.title: Shade Color
variables.explanation: The shade color is used by inline tab bars, as well as the transitions in leaflets and flaps, and info bar borders.

variables.name: scrollbar_outline_color
variables.title: Scrollbar Outline Color
variables.explanation: The scrollbar outline color is used by scrollbars to ensure that overlay scrollbars are visible regardless of the content color.
